alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 5:12PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern California, including the following counties, in southeast California, Imperial. In southern California, Riverside. * WHEN...Until midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tarantula Wash, Salton Sea, Tule Wash, Wonderstone Wash, Coral Wash, San Felipe Creek, South Fork Palm Wash, Alamo River and Iris Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salton City, Chiriaco Summit, North Shore, Bombay Beach, Salton Sea Beach, Desert Shores, Calipatria, Imperial Hot Mineral Springs, Winona, Coolidge Springs and Niland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
